title: Ziplm: Gzip-Backed Language Model
dot:
digraph ziplm{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];ziplm[label="ziplm
Useless but mildly interesting language model using compressors built-in to Python" shape=ellipse];usage[label="Usage"];training[label="Train Model
- data = open(my_favorite_text_file).read().lower()
- model = ziplm.ZipModel(alphabet, training=data)"];forward_sampling[label="Forward Sample
- model.sample_sequence(100)"];probability[label="Calculate Probability
- model.sequence_logprob('sequence')"];why_it_works[label="Why does this 'work'?"];fact1[label="1. Language model as distribution
p(x | c)"];fact2[label="2. Equivalence between probability distributions and codes"];how_well[label="How well does it work?"];example[label="Example Output
- 'theudcanvas...'
- recognizable parts"];ziplm->usage;usage->training;usage->forward_sampling;usage->probability;ziplm->why_it_works;why_it_works->fact1;why_it_works->fact2;ziplm->how_well;how_well->example;stars[label="Stars: 249"];forks[label="Forks: 9"];ziplm->stars;ziplm->forks;}
